attributes.content: Shaanxi Construction and Installation Group Co., Ltd., established in 1955, is a large state-owned general contracting enterprise with double special-grade qualifications under the provincial government. It is the vice chairman unit of the China Installation Association, China Nonferrous Metals Construction Association, China Engineering Construction Standardization Association, and Shaanxi Provincial Construction Industry Association.

body.value:
Shaanxi Construction and Installation Group Co., Ltd., established in 1955, is a large state-owned general contracting enterprise with double special-grade qualifications under the provincial government. It is the vice chairman unit of the China Installation Association, China Nonferrous Metals Construction Association, China Engineering Construction Standardization Association, and Shaanxi Provincial Construction Industry Association. The group has a registered capital of 1.5497 billion yuan and holds Class A design qualifications in the chemical, petrochemical, and pharmaceutical industries, municipal industries, and building intelligent systems. It also has Class A design qualifications for electromechanical design institutes. It possesses two special-grade general contracting qualifications in petrochemical and municipal public works, four Class 1 general contracting qualifications in electromechanical, metallurgical, building, and power engineering, and three Class 2 general contracting qualifications in mining, highway, and water conservancy and hydropower engineering. It also has nine professional contracting qualifications in electronics and intelligence, fire protection facilities, steel structure, building electromechanical, building decoration, waterproofing, anticorrosion and insulation, environmental protection, urban and road lighting, and nuclear engineering; and possesses licenses for pressure pipelines, pressure vessels, boilers, lifting machinery, elevator installation, transformation and maintenance, and licenses for the installation, repair, and testing of electrical facilities. It has the general contracting capability integrating engineering investment, design, construction, and management, and its business covers international and domestic engineering contracting, industrial investment, real estate development, operation and maintenance, equipment manufacturing, and material trade.

For a long time, the Group has adhered to innovation-driven development and scientific management, creating a good corporate Brand with excellent engineering quality and customer-centric service. It has won 3 National Science and Technology Progress Awards, obtained 149 national patents (including 24 invention patents), 3 national-level construction methods, and 90 provincial-level construction methods. It has also been the chief editor and participant in the compilation of 22 national industry standards. It has won 26 National Excellent Engineering Awards (including 4 National Excellent Engineering Gold Awards), 23 China Construction Engineering Luban Awards, 4 Zhan Tianyou Awards, 21 China Installation Engineering Quality Awards (China Installation Stars), 9 National Chemical Industry Excellent Engineering Awards, and 4 China Nonferrous Metals Industry Excellent Engineering Awards. It has also received honorary titles such as "National Civilized Unit," "National Contract-Honoring and Credit-Keeping Enterprise," "National AAA-Level Credit Enterprise in the Construction Industry," "National Model Labor Relations Harmonious Enterprise," "National Advanced Enterprise in the Construction Industry," "National User Satisfaction Installation Enterprise," "Top Ten (Industry) Brands of China's Enterprise Influence," "Top 80 Chinese Contractors," and "Top 200 Enterprises in China's Construction Industry Competitiveness."

The Group upholds the corporate philosophy of "Building for Good" and adheres to the core values of "People-Oriented, Innovation, Responsibility, Collaboration, and Win-Win." It has built a five-in-one business system of "Investment, Design, Construction, Operation, and Smart Manufacturing." It adheres to the business policy of giving equal importance to both inside and outside the province and both domestic and international markets. With the vision of "becoming a modern engineering service provider with value-creation capabilities," it is willing to work hand in hand with friends from all walks of life to seek common development.

 

(Source: Company)

We would like to proceed with our efforts and activities without compromising integrity and honesty in a family consisting of all employees.

body.value:
MISSION

Our mission is to take part in contemporary and high-quality projects so that our name is mentioned with respect and success both domestically and internationally. We would like to proceed with our efforts and activities without compromising integrity and honesty in a family consisting of all employees.

In the years to come, the concepts of “contemporary corporate governance” and “sustainable growth” will continue to be our main aims. On the way leading us to these aims, our group and all employees will continue to maintain the principles for quality, business ethics, transparency and social responsibility.

VISION

Our vision is to be a leading construction company in the international arena to carry out larger and more complex projects, making use of the state-of-the-art technology and international quality standards in an entrepreneurial, innovative and reliable approach.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: ZERGOUN GREEN ENERGY is a private Algerian company and one of the subsidiaries of ZERGOUN BROTHERS GROUP.ZGE aims to expand in the field of renewable energy, particularly in the production of PV modules through the operation of the largest highly automated factory in Africa, with a capacity of over 200 MW per year.This factory uses 100 famous European products and the latest technologies, including “bankable” glasses (double glazing) and highly efficient “Mono Perc” cells.

body.value:
ZERGOUN GREEN ENERGY is a private Algerian company and one of the subsidiaries of ZERGOUN BROTHERS GROUP.

ZGE aims to expand in the field of renewable energy, particularly in the production of PV modules through the operation of the largest highly automated factory in Africa, with a capacity of over 200 MW per year.

This factory uses 100 famous European products and the latest technologies, including “bankable” glasses (double glazing) and highly efficient “Mono Perc” cells.

Our modules can produce up to 405 Wp per module, which is the best compromise between production and temperature degradation available on the market.

 

(Source: Company)
body.processed:

This factory uses 100 famous European products and the latest technologies, including “bankable” glasses (double glazing) and highly efficient “Mono Perc” cells.

Our modules can produce up to 405 Wp per module, which is the best compromise between production and temperature degradation available on the market.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The company quickly identified the role it had to play and the challenges of a very sensitive and strategic sector for the country: Energy. This commodity, essential to the development of a people and a country, was going to be the company's primary focus. The company thus expanded its activities and is developing around the manufacturing and installation of generator sets, the EPC construction of power plants, and the maintenance of electrical production equipment, with a new name, Amimer Énergie®.

body.value:
The company quickly identified the role it had to play and the challenges of a very sensitive and strategic sector for the country: Energy. This commodity, essential to the development of a people and a country, was going to be the company's primary focus. The company thus expanded its activities and is developing around the manufacturing and installation of generator sets, the EPC construction of power plants, and the maintenance of electrical production equipment, with a new name, Amimer Énergie®.

Thanks to his vision and perseverance, the company, which was initially just a simple SME, began to grow and become a major player in energy equipment and solutions in Algeria and in the North and sub-Saharan African region.
                   
The company was one of the pioneers in understanding the importance of governance in the efficient and transparent management of a company by integrating an investment fund into its capital in 2012.
                   
Amimer Energie employs nearly 400 people across its three sites, namely the Seddouk manufacturing plant in Bejaia, the assembly and maintenance workshops in Blida and its administrative headquarters in Algiers.
                   
Certified ISO 9001 and OHAS 18001, the company has always worked towards the continuous improvement of its products. The generator production unit with an annual capacity of 2000 units has been awarded the "Basma Djazairia" label thanks to the integration of engineering, boilermaking, electrical engineering, and assembly activities.
                   
Through its experience, Amimer Energie continues to seek the best energy solutions for its customers and actively participates in the development of the national economy. It is a living example of the success of the local integration policy to which it has adhered since its creation.
                   
This is how it was able to support many Algerian signatures in the implementation of energy production solutions and was a fundamental player in the development of the electricity network through the installation of nearly 200 MW and for the benefit of isolated regions in southern Algeria in large part.
                   
The company supports its evolution by developing its human resources through learning and training on new technologies. It has successfully established a center of expertise in the maintenance of energy production machines of different technologies such as MTU, IVECO, CUMMINS, PERKINS and General Electric USA.
                   
Aware of the importance of the global energy transition and the new strategy adopted by the State for the generalization of renewable energies, the company adhering to this philosophy has initiated several initiatives in this direction and is pleased to be a leader in the Algerian market in the field.
                   
The company aims to be an active player in the field of renewable energies as an EPC (Engineering, Procurement & Commissioning) solutions provider but also as an IPP (Independent Power Producer), developer and owner of electricity production plants, and company operating and maintaining solar power plants.
                   
Sensitive to the importance of research and development in supporting innovation and the continual search for optimal and efficient solutions, the company has set up a research and development office currently working on innovative solutions in the areas of zero-fuel energy production, for which patents have been filed.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: EURL HAMDI, founded in 1990, employs approximately 250 people with many years of experience in administrative, electrical, mechanical, and tooling specializations related to installation activities.EURL HAMDI therefore operates in a broad-based service and supply context for strategically important sectors. Thanks to its years of experience, it offers flexibility and versatility in its offerings, tailored methodologies, and cost-effective solutions, acquired through years of experience in construction and technical offices.

body.value:
EURL HAMDI, founded in 1990, employs approximately 250 people with many years of experience in administrative, electrical, mechanical, and tooling specializations related to installation activities.

EURL HAMDI therefore operates in a broad-based service and supply context for strategically important sectors. Thanks to its years of experience, it offers flexibility and versatility in its offerings, tailored methodologies, and cost-effective solutions, acquired through years of experience in construction and technical offices.

The company provides highly qualified, equipped, and specialized personnel for various projects, such as:

- Industrial electrical installations (electrical substations, transformers, circuit breakers, etc.);

- Pre-commissioning and commissioning of electrical, instrumentation, and mechanical equipment and installations;

- Assembly and disassembly work during the overhaul and rehabilitation of machines and compressors;

- Monitoring of industrial assembly work;

- Pipeline construction.

- Civil engineering work.

- Engineering.

- Drilling.

- Fencing.

- Provision of qualified personnel.

- Rental and provision of various equipment:

- Vehicles and machinery.

- Special equipment: generators, welding stations, refrigerated storage cabinets, cold rooms.

- Provision of special vehicles: service trucks, tankers, storage tanks, ambulances, fire trucks, tow trucks, agricultural tractors, etc.

- Our company has the human and material resources, allowing it to take charge of the assembly and commissioning reserves (mechanical, electro-instrumental) of the projects under guarantee in compliance with the contractual and operating requirements. EURL HAMDI, founded in 1990, has approximately 250 people with many years of experience in administrative, electrical, mechanical and tool specializations related to installation activities. EURL HAMDI is therefore placed in a context of service and large-scale supplies for sectors of strategic importance which, due to the experience acquired over the years, allow it to practice flexibility and versatility in its offer, adapted methodologies and an economic nature of the achievements acquired over years of experience on site and in the technical office. The company will provide you with highly qualified, equipped and specialized personnel in the various interventions such as: - Industrial installations of an electrical nature (Electrical substation, transformers, circuit breakers, etc.); - Pre-commissioning and Commissioning works of electrical, instrumentation and mechanical equipment and installations; - Assembly and dismantling works caused during the revision and rehabilitation works of machines and compressors; - Monitoring of industrial assembly works; - Construction of the Pipeline. - Civil engineering works. - Engineering. - Drilling. - Fencing. - Provision of qualified personnel. - Rental and provision of various equipment: - Vehicles and machines. - Special equipment: generators, welding stations, refrigerated cabinets, cold rooms. - Provision of special vehicles: station trucks, tankers, storage tanks, ambulances, fire trucks, breakdown trucks, agricultural tractors etc. - Our company has the human and material resources, allowing it to take charge of assembly and commissioning reserves (mechanical, electro-instrumental) of projects under guarantee in compliance with contractual and operating requirements.

 

(Source: Company LinkedIn)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Export-Import Bank of Korea (Korea Eximbank or KEXIM) is South Korea’s official export credit agency, established in 1976 to support the nation’s export-led economic growth and international cooperation. KEXIM provides a wide range of financial services, including export and import loans, trade finance, overseas investment credit, and comprehensive guarantee programs. Its primary mission is to help Korean companies expand globally by offering financial solutions tailored to international business and development projects.

body.value:
The Export-Import Bank of Korea (Korea Eximbank or KEXIM) is South Korea’s official export credit agency, established in 1976 to support the nation’s export-led economic growth and international cooperation. KEXIM provides a wide range of financial services, including export and import loans, trade finance, overseas investment credit, and comprehensive guarantee programs. Its primary mission is to help Korean companies expand globally by offering financial solutions tailored to international business and development projects.

Korea Eximbank also manages two key government-entrusted funds: the Economic Development Cooperation Fund (EDCF), which delivers official development assistance to developing countries, and the Inter-Korean Cooperation Fund (IKCF), which supports economic collaboration with North Korea.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Government of Cape Verde takes place in a framework of a semi-presidential representative democratic republic,[1] whereby the Prime Minister of Cape Verde is the head of government and the President of the Republic of Cape Verde is the head of state, and of a multi-party system. Executive power is exercised by the President and the Government. Legislative power is vested in both the Government and the National Assembly. The Judiciary is independent of the executive and the legislature.

body.value: Government of Cape Verde takes place in a framework of a semi-presidential representative democratic republic,[1] whereby the Prime Minister of Cape Verde is the head of government and the President of the Republic of Cape Verde is the head of state, and of a multi-party system. Executive power is exercised by the President and the Government. Legislative power is vested in both the Government and the National Assembly. The Judiciary is independent of the executive and the legislature. The constitution first approved in 1980 and substantially revised in 1992 forms the basis of government organization. It declares that the government is the "organ that defines, leads, and executes the general internal and external policy of the country" and is responsible to the National Assembly.

It declares that the government is the "organ that defines, leads, and executes the general internal and external policy of the country" and is responsible to the National Assembly.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: For over 15 years, the Magma Group has been the leading private geotechnical laboratory in Africa.The company has the latest generation equipment required for the laboratory activity for buildings, roads, engineering structures, industrial and mining constructions.We are the only laboratory to own a fleet of jackup barges for geotechnical studies in the Maghreb and Africa Regions.Magma International has a network of partner laboratories in the Maghreb and Europe to address the specific needs of our customers.

body.value:
For over 15 years, the Magma Group has been the leading private geotechnical laboratory in Africa.
The company has the latest generation equipment required for the laboratory activity for buildings, roads, engineering structures, industrial and mining constructions.

We are the only laboratory to own a fleet of jackup barges for geotechnical studies in the Maghreb and Africa Regions.

Magma International has a network of partner laboratories in the Maghreb and Europe to address the specific needs of our customers.

Our laboratories perform the tests according to the standards required by our customers, whether European (EN & NF), American (ASTM & AASTHO) or international (ISO).

Operating daily in the sub-region, our teams are composed of engineers, technicians and sounders who acquired their experience in either Tunisia or France.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: RSK Geosciences is a leading UK-based site investigation, contaminated land, geotechnical and sustainable solutions consultancy. Staffed by more than 300 professionals, we have been operating for more than 30 years. Located in 20 offices throughout the UK, our vast network responds quickly to client enquiries, rapidly mobilises teams to site and uses the latest technology to ensure an efficient flow of data among sites, offices and clients.

body.value:
RSK Geosciences is a leading UK-based site investigation, contaminated land, geotechnical and sustainable solutions consultancy. Staffed by more than 300 professionals, we have been operating for more than 30 years. Located in 20 offices throughout the UK, our vast network responds quickly to client enquiries, rapidly mobilises teams to site and uses the latest technology to ensure an efficient flow of data among sites, offices and clients.

We help our clients to realise sustainable opportunities and understand the potential liabilities associated with acquiring, owning, operating, developing and divesting land. We work for the public and private sectors, including many of the UK’s leading property developers, major and local housebuilders, utility providers, main contractors, local authorities and other governmental organisations.

RSK Geosciences expanded its consultancy capabilities through strategic integration with Leap Environmental and Carbon Zero Consulting (CZC). In the process, RSK Geosciences acquired extensive experience and expertise in renewable energy technology, sustainable development and carbon assessment by merging with two established RSK Group companies.

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Public Works, Housing, and Water Resources (MOPHRH) in Mozambique is responsible for overseeing the development, maintenance, and regulation of the country's public infrastructure. This includes roads, bridges, housing, and water resources. The Ministry aims to improve living conditions and promote sustainable development by ensuring the effective management of these critical sectors. Their work involves planning, implementing, and supervising various projects and initiatives to enhance the nation's infrastructure and public services.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Mozambique is a presidential republic where the President serves as both the head of state and government. The government is based on a multi-party system, with the FRELIMO party being the dominant political force since the country’s independence in 1975. The National Assembly is the legislative body, responsible for enacting laws. Mozambique faces challenges such as corruption and economic disparities but is also rich in natural resources. Recent efforts have been made to improve governance and foster economic growth.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: SOMAFEL – Engenharia e Obras Ferroviárias, S.A. | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: SOMAFEL – Engenharia e Obras Ferroviárias, S.A. is a Portuguese engineering and construction company specializing in railway infrastructure. Established in 1956 by Diogo Pereira Coutinho, SOMAFEL has over 60 years of experience in constructing, renewing, and maintaining railway systems, including tracks, bridges, and related civil works. The company has undertaken projects across Europe, Africa, and South America, contributing to significant railway developments in countries like Angola, Mozambique, Morocco, and Brazil.

body.value: SOMAFEL – Engenharia e Obras Ferroviárias, S.A. is a Portuguese engineering and construction company specializing in railway infrastructure. Established in 1956 by Diogo Pereira Coutinho, SOMAFEL has over 60 years of experience in constructing, renewing, and maintaining railway systems, including tracks, bridges, and related civil works. The company has undertaken projects across Europe, Africa, and South America, contributing to significant railway developments in countries like Angola, Mozambique, Morocco, and Brazil. In 1992, SOMAFEL became part of the Teixeira Duarte Group, enhancing its capabilities and international reach. Notably, SOMAFEL has been involved in major projects such as the modernization of the Ressano Garcia railway in Mozambique and the construction of new railway lines in Portugal.

attributes.content: The Government of Ogun State, Nigeria, oversees the administration of the southwestern state, headed by the Governor. It manages ministries, agencies, and departments responsible for education, healthcare, infrastructure, and economic development. Ogun State, known for its robust industrial and agricultural sectors, focuses on economic growth, attracting investments, and enhancing infrastructure to improve residents' quality of life. Established on February 3, 1976, it was named after the Ogun River, which traverses the state from North to South.

body.value:
ABOUT THE GROUP
Hongxing Steel Company Limited is the pioneer vehicle of the Inner Galaxy Group, the Group operates through five subsidiaries:

  • Hongxing Steel Company Limited.
  • Inner Galaxy Steel Company Limited.
  • Jiuxing Intergrity Industries Company Limited.
  • Inner Galaxy Oil & Gas Ltd

 

ABOUT OUR WORK
We are West Africa’s leading manufacturer of steel products for the building and construction industry; automobile and automotive industry; industrial machinery, appliances; oil and gas industry; amongst many others.

We are also involved in agric and industrial vehicle assemblage; ship-scrapping and oil and gas industry services.

 

(Source: Company)

body.value: The Tanzania National Roads Agency (TANROADS) was established on July 1st, 2000, following an order published in Government Gazette Notice No. 293 of 2000 under Section 3(1) of the Executive Agencies Act No. 30 of 1997. Its formation aimed to achieve substantial enhancements in the quality, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness of road maintenance and development. TANROADS oversees a network encompassing 35,000 kilometers of roads, comprising 12,786 kilometers of trunk roads and 22,214 kilometers of regional roads, as defined by the Roads Act No. 13 of 2007 and subsequent reclassifications up to June 2015.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: General Emballage is the leader in the corrugated cardboard industry in Algeria. We manufacture, to order, double-sided (B, C, E, and F flutes) and double-double (BC and BE) sheets, packaging, and displays. We also carry out high-resolution post-printing in up to 6 colors with full or selective varnishing.Our teams master all production tasks:Studies.Prototyping.Production of cutting shapes and printing films.Manufacturing of packaging and displays.Delivery.

body.value:
General Emballage is the leader in the corrugated cardboard industry in Algeria. We manufacture, to order, double-sided (B, C, E, and F flutes) and double-double (BC and BE) sheets, packaging, and displays. We also carry out high-resolution post-printing in up to 6 colors with full or selective varnishing.

Our teams master all production tasks:

Studies.
Prototyping.
Production of cutting shapes and printing films.
Manufacturing of packaging and displays.
Delivery.


Started in 2002, Général Emballage is a capital company with a share capital of 2,000,000,000 DZD operating on 3 industrial sites (Akbou, Oran and Sétif) with more than 1,200 employees and a turnover of 19 billion DZD. Général Emballage is certified compliant with the Integrated Quality-Health and Safety at Work (S&ST)-Environment Management System (ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015, ISO 45001:2018).

Our head office is at ZAC Taharacht, Akbou, in the wilaya (governorate) of Béjaia.

attributes.content: Ministry of Infrastructure, Communication and Transport (MoICT) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Infrastructure, Communication and Transport (MoICT) is a governmental body under the Revolutionary Government of Zanzibar, tasked with the development and oversight of infrastructure, communication, and transportation sectors within Zanzibar.

body.value:
The Ministry of Infrastructure, Communication and Transport (MoICT) is a governmental body under the Revolutionary Government of Zanzibar, tasked with the development and oversight of infrastructure, communication, and transportation sectors within Zanzibar. 

Established in April 2016, MoICT succeeded the former Ministry of Infrastructure and Communication. Its responsibilities encompass the planning, implementation, and maintenance of public infrastructure projects, including roads, airports, ports, and communication networks. The ministry plays a pivotal role in enhancing connectivity and supporting economic growth across the islands.

The ministry plays a pivotal role in enhancing connectivity and supporting economic growth across the islands.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Standard Chartered, established in the UK in 1853, operates from its headquarters at 1 Basinghall Avenue in London, where both the Group CEO and Chairman are located. Regulated by the Prudential Regulation Authority and the Financial Conduct Authority, it is one of the UK’s largest banks and a FTSE100 company listed since 1969.

body.value:
Standard Chartered, established in the UK in 1853, operates from its headquarters at 1 Basinghall Avenue in London, where both the Group CEO and Chairman are located. Regulated by the Prudential Regulation Authority and the Financial Conduct Authority, it is one of the UK’s largest banks and a FTSE100 company listed since 1969.

London serves as the hub for Standard Chartered's Europe and Americas business, facilitating operations across Asia, Africa, and the Middle East. The location supports Corporate, Commercial, and Institutional Banking, as well as a significant Private Banking presence in the region.

Since July 2010, Standard Chartered has proudly sponsored Liverpool Football Club, highlighting its commitment to community engagement and global visibility.

attributes.content: ALN is an integrated alliance of the preeminent full-service corporate law firms in 14 African countries: Algeria, Côte d’Ivoire, Ethiopia, Guinea, Kenya, Madagascar, Mauritius, Morocco, Nigeria, Rwanda, Sudan, Tanzania, Uganda and Zambia. ALN also has a regional office in Dubai, UAE, which serves as a gateway to the Gulf region and beyond.

body.value:
ALN is an integrated alliance of the preeminent full-service corporate law firms in 14 African countries: Algeria, Côte d’Ivoire, Ethiopia, Guinea, Kenya, Madagascar, Mauritius, Morocco, Nigeria, Rwanda, Sudan, Tanzania, Uganda and Zambia. 

ALN also has a regional office in Dubai, UAE, which serves as a gateway to the Gulf region and beyond.
 

Vision
ALN seamlessly connects the African continent. It brings its global expertise, continental reach and deep local know-how to help its clients navigate the multitude of opportunities and risks in Africa, holistically combining legal, tax, regulatory and commercial advice.


Mission
ALN is dedicated to its clients’ success. ALN achieves this by providing world class legal, tax and regulatory advice in a commercial context. ALN’s lawyers are aware of the trends and events shaping the continent, deeply networked and respected in their communities as thought leaders and opinion shapers. ALN’s lawyers have a Pan African mindset, are down to earth, pragmatic, responsive, innovative and relentlessly determined.

 

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Mwananchi Engineering and Contracting Company Limited (MECCO Ltd) is one of Tanzania's oldest and largest private local construction companies. Established on February 10, 1964, MECCO has over 50 years of experience in executing major civil engineering and building projects across the country. Notable landmarks constructed by MECCO include the Bank of Tanzania building and Mount Meru Hotel in Arusha, Bombo Regional Hospital in Tanga, NIC Investment House and Kariakoo Market in Dar es Salaam, and the Parliament Complex in Dodoma.

body.value:
Mwananchi Engineering and Contracting Company Limited (MECCO Ltd) is one of Tanzania's oldest and largest private local construction companies. Established on February 10, 1964, MECCO has over 50 years of experience in executing major civil engineering and building projects across the country. Notable landmarks constructed by MECCO include the Bank of Tanzania building and Mount Meru Hotel in Arusha, Bombo Regional Hospital in Tanga, NIC Investment House and Kariakoo Market in Dar es Salaam, and the Parliament Complex in Dodoma. 

MECCO offers a comprehensive range of services, including the construction of roads, bridges, sewerage systems, and airport runways. The company is committed to quality and safety, ensuring that all employees are trained in safety programs and environmental protection measures.

attributes.content: Established in 1987, Botswana Railways (BR) serves as a vital link in the Southern African regional railway systems. With a strategically laid rail network and strong relationships with other operators, BR's freight services offer the most suitable, reliable, and cost-effective mode of transport for bulk commodities. BR's freight service specifically targets commodities that may pose operational challenges for other modes of transport.

attributes.content: Athi Water Works Development Agency (AWWDA) is one of the nine (9) Water Works Development Agencies (WWDA) established under the Ministry of Water,  Sanitation & Irrigation. It was established under the Water Act 2016 vide Legal Notice No. 28 of 26th April 2019.Agency is responsible for the development, maintenance and management of water and sewerage infrastructure in the counties of Nairobi, Kiambu and Muranga Counties covering 5,800.4Km2 with a total population of 9,320,287 people.

body.value: Athi Water Works Development Agency (AWWDA) is one of the nine (9) Water Works Development Agencies (WWDA) established under the Ministry of Water,  Sanitation & Irrigation. It was established under the Water Act 2016 vide Legal Notice No. 28 of 26th April 2019.Agency is responsible for the development, maintenance and management of water and sewerage infrastructure in the counties of Nairobi, Kiambu and Muranga Counties covering 5,800.4Km2 with a total population of 9,320,287 people. Currently, the Agency has a bulk water production capacity of 664,337m3/day and a wastewater treatment capacity of 210,500 m3/day.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Lesotho Highlands Development Authority (LHDA) was set up to manage that part of the project that falls within Lesotho’s borders. It is answerable to a Board of Directors which is responsible for the performance and affairs of the LHDA. As stipulated in Protocol VI, the Board reports to the LHWC.

body.value: The Lesotho Highlands Development Authority (LHDA) was set up to manage that part of the project that falls within Lesotho’s borders. It is answerable to a Board of Directors which is responsible for the performance and affairs of the LHDA. As stipulated in Protocol VI, the Board reports to the LHWC. As the project implementing authority, the LHDA is responsible for the implementation, operation and maintenance of the components of the project in Lesotho, including the social, environmental and economic developments of the project such as resettlement, compensation, the supply of water to resettled villages, irrigation, fish hatcheries and tourism.

attributes.content: AMEA Power LLC (AMEA), a subsidiary of Al Nowais Investments LLC, operates as a power producer specializing in renewable and thermal power projects. The company engages in the acquisition, development, financing, construction, and operation of clean power generation assets, encompassing solar, battery, wind, hybrid power, and combined cycle gas turbine stations. body.value: AMEA Power LLC (AMEA), a subsidiary of Al Nowais Investments LLC, operates as a power producer specializing in renewable and thermal power projects. The company engages in the acquisition, development, financing, construction, and operation of clean power generation assets, encompassing solar, battery, wind, hybrid power, and combined cycle gas turbine stations. Offering a comprehensive suite of power solutions, AMEA provides services including project development, finance, engineering, procurement, construction, as well as operation and maintenance of renewable energy power plants. Serving emerging markets primarily in the Middle East, Africa, and Asian regions, AMEA manages a diverse portfolio, with notable projects such as Al Husainiyah in Jordan, Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Photovoltaic Power Plant in Togo, and Abour Energy Co in Jordan. Headquartered in Dubai, UAE, the company maintains its operational focus on delivering sustainable power solutions across various geographical areas.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Algerian Ministry of Public Works and Basic Facilities (وزارة الأشغال العمومية والمنشآت القاعدية) is a government body responsible for the development, maintenance, and regulation of Algeria's public infrastructure. This includes a wide range of essential services and projects such as:

body.value:
The Algerian Ministry of Public Works and Basic Facilities (وزارة الأشغال العمومية والمنشآت القاعدية) is a government body responsible for the development, maintenance, and regulation of Algeria's public infrastructure. This includes a wide range of essential services and projects such as:  

  • Roads and Highways: Planning, construction, and upkeep of the national road network, including the East-West Highway.   
  • Ports: Overseeing the development and management of Algeria's commercial ports, including major projects like the expansion of Djen Djen Port.   
  • Railways: Development and modernization of the national railway network.   
  • Airports: Management and expansion of airport infrastructure.
  • Basic Infrastructure: This can encompass various other essential facilities that contribute to the country's overall development.

The Ministry plays a crucial role in Algeria's economic development by providing the necessary infrastructure for trade, transportation, and overall connectivity. It initiates and manages large-scale projects and sets the policies and regulations for the public works and infrastructure sectors.

  • Basic Infrastructure: This can encompass various other essential facilities that contribute to the country's overall development.

The Ministry plays a crucial role in Algeria's economic development by providing the necessary infrastructure for trade, transportation, and overall connectivity. It initiates and manages large-scale projects and sets the policies and regulations for the public works and infrastructure sectors.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Entreprise Portuaire de Djen Djen (EPDJ), also known as the Djen Djen Port Company, is a state-owned company responsible for managing and operating the Port of Djen Djen, located in the Wilaya of Jijel, Algeria. Established in 1993, EPDJ oversees one of the largest deep-water ports in the Mediterranean, strategically situated less than 50 miles from the maritime route connecting the Suez Canal to the Strait of Gibraltar. The port spans an area of 210 hectares and boasts a draft depth of up to 18.20 meters, allowing it to accommodate a wide range of vessels.

body.value:
The Entreprise Portuaire de Djen Djen (EPDJ), also known as the Djen Djen Port Company, is a state-owned company responsible for managing and operating the Port of Djen Djen, located in the Wilaya of Jijel, Algeria. 

Established in 1993, EPDJ oversees one of the largest deep-water ports in the Mediterranean, strategically situated less than 50 miles from the maritime route connecting the Suez Canal to the Strait of Gibraltar. The port spans an area of 210 hectares and boasts a draft depth of up to 18.20 meters, allowing it to accommodate a wide range of vessels. 

EPDJ provides comprehensive maritime services, including navigation assistance, cargo handling, and logistics support, positioning the port as a key hub for regional and international trade.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Founded in 2002, Globeleq has become a power industry leader by operating or acquiring interest in multiple power facilities across the world.  Now with its focus on the African continent, the company’s experience in implementing an array of generating technologies in different geographic locations, provides Globeleq with a unique perspective and strong foundation for developing new capacity.

body.value:
Founded in 2002, Globeleq has become a power industry leader by operating or acquiring interest in multiple power facilities across the world.  Now with its focus on the African continent, the company’s experience in implementing an array of generating technologies in different geographic locations, provides Globeleq with a unique perspective and strong foundation for developing new capacity.

Under the ownership of shareholders CDC (70%) and Norfund (30%), the cornerstone of our strategy is to be the trusted, reliable and committed partner of choice within the African IPP industry. We will achieve this by adding significant MWs of new power generation over the next decade while positively contributing and impacting the communities in which we operate.

With the support and expertise of our staff operating out of our London head office, our regional offices in Nairobi, Cape Town, and Douala, and our 13 power plants located in Tanzania, South Africa, Côte d’Ivoire, Cameroon and Kenya, we currently generate more than 1,400 MW, and have another 2,000 MW in development.

Berkeley Energy, founded in 2007, has deep renewable energy and power engineering, construction, and investment experience in developing markets, where it is a focused investor, developer, and delivers renewable power assets.

Berkeley Energy works with its partner companies to provide engineering, management, and financial support, whilst offering the ability to act as a bankable sponsor for renewable power projects.

Our approach is hands-on, asset-first, technically orientated. We look to achieve our returns by holding equity in well-conceived and constructed projects.

Berkeley Energy has offices in London, Singapore, Nairobi, Mauritius, Delhi, and Manila.

Members of the group are authorised and regulated by the United Kingdom Financial Conduct Authority and in Mauritius by the Financial Services Commission.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Suez Canal Automotive Terminal (SCAT) is a consortium entity established to develop, operate, and manage Egypt’s first dedicated Roll-on/Roll-off (RORO) terminal at East Port Said. Formed under a 30-year concession agreement with the Suez Canal Economic Zone (SCZONE), SCAT is a French-Japanese alliance comprising three major international companies specializing in port logistics and automotive handling.

body.value:
Suez Canal Automotive Terminal (SCAT) is a consortium entity established to develop, operate, and manage Egypt’s first dedicated Roll-on/Roll-off (RORO) terminal at East Port Said. Formed under a 30-year concession agreement with the Suez Canal Economic Zone (SCZONE), SCAT is a French-Japanese alliance comprising three major international companies specializing in port logistics and automotive handling. The consortium is responsible for designing, financing, constructing, and operating the terminal, aiming to position East Port Said as a leading RORO logistics hub in the Eastern Mediterranean.

The consortium comprises three major international companies:

  1. Toyota Tsusho Corporation: The trading arm of Toyota, bringing extensive experience in automotive logistics.
    Automotive Logistics
  2. Nippon Yusen Kaisha (NYK Line): A leading Japanese shipping company specializing in maritime transport.
  3. Bolloré Africa Logistics: A French company and one of Africa's largest port operators, providing logistics and infrastructure expertise.

attributes.content: APM Terminals is a leading global port and terminal operator headquartered in The Hague, Netherlands. As a subsidiary of the A.P. Moller-Maersk Group, the company specializes in managing container terminals and providing integrated cargo and inland services. With a presence in over 60 countries, APM Terminals operates more than 60 port and terminal facilities worldwide, employing approximately 22,000 professionals. The company's mission is to be the world's best terminal company by 2026, focusing on safety, efficiency, and sustainability in its operations.
